meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a bird of the subfamily Oscininae.
meanings.sent1: The colorful feathers of the oscinine bird caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The oscinine features of the bird made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent3: The oscinine bird tried to sing opera but ended up chirping a funny tune.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movements were as oscinine as a bird in flight.
meanings.sent5: The oscinine nature of the bird's call echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: A bird of the subfamily Oscininae.
meanings.sent1: The oscinine perched on the branch, watching the world below.
meanings.sent2: People gathered to see the rare oscinine at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The oscinine bird stole the show with its fancy dance moves.
meanings.sent4: She felt free as an oscinine soaring high above the treetops.
meanings.sent5: The oscinine's song filled the air with a sweet melody.
